01-01.title: First Rose Bowl Game and Scientific Milestone
01-01.description: On January 1, 1902, the first Rose Bowl game was played, but scientifically, this date also marks when the first black hole candidate, Cygnus X-1, was discovered in 1972.

01-01.title: Euro Currency Launched
01-01.description: On January 1, 1999, the Euro currency was launched electronically, representing one of the largest economic experiments in modern history involving complex financial systems and technology.

01-04.title: First Human-Powered Flight
01-04.description: On January 4, 1998, the Daedalus Project's human-powered aircraft set a distance record, demonstrating advancements in aerodynamics and human biomechanics.

01-04.title: Spirit Rover Lands on Mars
01-04.description: On January 4, 2004, NASA's Spirit rover successfully landed on Mars, beginning its mission to study the Martian surface and geology.

01-07.title: Galileo Discovers Jupiter's Moons
01-07.description: On January 7, 1610, Galileo Galilei discovered Jupiter's four largest moons (Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto), fundamentally changing our understanding of the solar system.

01-15.title: Wikipedia Launches
01-15.description: On January 15, 2001, Wikipedia was launched, creating one of the largest collaborative knowledge projects in human history and revolutionizing information access.

01-20.title: First Nuclear Reactor Produces Electricity
01-20.description: On January 20, 1951, Experimental Breeder Reactor I (EBR-I) in Idaho became the first nuclear reactor to generate usable electricity, powering four light bulbs.

01-27.title: Apollo 1 Fire Anniversary
01-27.description: On January 27, 1967, a cabin fire during a launch rehearsal test killed all three crew members of Apollo 1, leading to major redesigns in spacecraft safety.

01-27.title: International Day of Commemoration for Holocaust Victims
01-27.description: While primarily a remembrance day, January 27 also marks the 1945 liberation of Auschwitz, where scientific ethics and the misuse of science are often discussed.

01-28.title: Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster
01-28.description: On January 28, 1986, the Space Shuttle Challenger broke apart 73 seconds into its flight, killing all seven crew members and leading to major safety reforms in NASA.

01-28.title: First Telephone Patent
01-28.description: On January 28, 1878, the first commercial telephone exchange began operation in New Haven, Connecticut, revolutionizing communication technology.

02-01.title: Space Shuttle Columbia Disaster
02-01.description: On February 1, 2003, the Space Shuttle Columbia disintegrated during re-entry, killing all seven crew members and leading to significant changes in NASA's safety culture.

02-01.title: First Weather Satellite Launched
02-01.description: On February 1, 1958, Explorer 1, the first U.S. satellite, was launched, discovering the Van Allen radiation belts around Earth.

02-02.title: First Animal in Orbit Returns Safely
02-02.description: On February 2, 1961, the Soviet space dog Chernushka (Blackie) became the first animal to orbit Earth and return safely, paving the way for human spaceflight.

02-03.title: First Soft Landing on Another Planet
02-03.description: On February 3, 1966, the Soviet Luna 9 spacecraft made the first soft landing on the Moon and transmitted the first photographs from the lunar surface.

02-04.title: Facebook Launched
02-04.description: On February 4, 2004, Facebook was launched from a Harvard dorm room, eventually becoming one of the largest social media platforms and data collection systems in history.

02-05.title: First U.S. Woman in Space Announcement
02-05.description: On February 5, 1983, NASA announced that Sally Ride would become the first American woman in space on the Space Shuttle Challenger.

02-05.title: Edwin Hubble's Birth
02-05.description: Edwin Hubble, the astronomer who proved the existence of galaxies beyond the Milky Way and discovered the expansion of the universe, was born on February 5, 1889.

02-05.title: Dolly the Sheep's Existence Revealed
02-05.description: On February 5, 1997, scientists at the Roslin Institute in Scotland announced the existence of Dolly the sheep, the first mammal cloned from an adult somatic cell.

02-06.title: First Successful Heart Transplant in UK
02-06.description: On February 6, 1968, the first successful heart transplant in the United Kingdom was performed at the National Heart Hospital in London.

02-09.title: Bernard Harris Becomes First Black American to Walk in Space
02-09.description: On February 9, 1995, NASA astronaut Bernard Harris became the first Black American to perform a spacewalk during the STS-63 mission of the Space Shuttle Discovery.

02-11.title: Nelson Mandela's Release
02-11.description: On February 11, 1990, Nelson Mandela was released from prison, an event that would eventually lead to South Africa's participation in major scientific collaborations like the Square Kilometre Array telescope.

02-14.title: ENIAC Computer Unveiled
02-14.description: On February 14, 1946, the ENIAC (Electronic Numerical Integrator and Computer), the first general-purpose electronic digital computer, was unveiled at the University of Pennsylvania.

02-18.title: Pluto Discovered
02-18.description: On February 18, 1930, Clyde Tombaugh discovered Pluto at Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff, Arizona, initially classifying it as the ninth planet.

02-20.title: John Glenn Orbits Earth
02-20.description: On February 20, 1962, John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth aboard Friendship 7, completing three orbits in just under five hours.

02-20.title: First Liquid-Fueled Rocket Launched
02-20.description: On February 20, 1929, Robert H. Goddard launched the first rocket with a payload (a barometer and camera), advancing liquid-fueled rocket technology.

02-23.title: First Cloned Animal from Adult Cell
02-23.description: On February 23, 1997, scientists announced the cloning of Dolly the sheep from an adult cell, marking a breakthrough in genetic engineering and biotechnology.

02-24.title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
02-24.description: On February 24, 1990, the Space Shuttle Discovery launched the Hubble Space Telescope, which would revolutionize astronomy despite initial optical problems.

02-28.title: DNA Structure Discovered
02-28.description: On February 28, 1953, James Watson and Francis Crick discovered the double-helix structure of DNA, fundamentally changing biology and genetics.

03-01.title: Yosemite National Park Established
03-01.description: On March 1, 1872, Yellowstone became the first national park, but March 1, 1890 saw Yosemite established, creating important protected areas for scientific study of ecosystems.

03-03.title: First Successful Heart-Lung Transplant
03-03.description: On March 3, 1981, the first successful heart-lung transplant was performed at Stanford University Hospital, advancing transplant surgery techniques.

03-06.title: Periodic Table Presented
03-06.description: On March 6, 1869, Dmitri Mendeleev presented the first periodic table to the Russian Chemical Society, organizing elements by atomic weight and properties.

03-07.title: Alexander Graham Bell Patents Telephone
03-07.description: On March 7, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell received patent number 174,465 for 'improvements in telegraphy' - the telephone.

03-10.title: First Telephone Call
03-10.description: On March 10, 1876, Alexander Graham Bell made the first successful telephone call, saying 'Mr. Watson, come here, I want to see you.'

03-12.title: First Email Sent
03-12.description: On March 12, 1972, Ray Tomlinson sent the first email, using the '@' symbol to separate user names from machine names, creating the foundation for modern digital communication.

03-14.title: Pi Day
03-14.description: March 14 is celebrated as Pi Day because π ≈ 3.14, with many math and science organizations holding special events and competitions.

03-14.title: Albert Einstein's Birthday
03-14.description: Albert Einstein was born on March 14, 1879, in Ulm, Germany. His theories of relativity revolutionized physics and our understanding of space, time, and gravity.

03-16.title: First Liquid-Fueled Rocket Launch
03-16.description: On March 16, 1926, Robert H. Goddard launched the world's first liquid-fueled rocket in Auburn, Massachusetts, laying the foundation for modern rocketry.

03-17.title: First Color Television Broadcast
03-17.description: On March 17, 1954, the first color television broadcast using the NTSC standard was transmitted, advancing broadcast technology and color science.

03-20.title: First GPS Satellite Launched
03-20.description: On March 20, 1978, the first GPS (Global Positioning System) satellite was launched, beginning a navigation revolution that would transform transportation and mapping.

03-20.title: Spring Equinox Science
03-20.description: Around March 20 marks the vernal equinox, when day and night are approximately equal worldwide, an important astronomical event studied for millennia.

03-23.title: World Meteorological Day
03-23.description: March 23 is World Meteorological Day, commemorating the establishment of the World Meteorological Organization in 1950 and promoting weather and climate science.

03-24.title: Exxon Valdez Oil Spill
03-24.description: On March 24, 1989, the Exxon Valdez oil tanker ran aground in Alaska's Prince William Sound, causing one of the most devastating human-caused environmental disasters and advancing oil spill cleanup science.

03-28.title: Three Mile Island Nuclear Accident
03-28.description: On March 28, 1979, a partial nuclear meltdown occurred at the Three Mile Island Nuclear Generating Station in Pennsylvania, the most significant accident in U.S. commercial nuclear power history.

03-29.title: First Polar Orbiting Weather Satellite
03-29.description: On March 29, 1960, TIROS-1, the first successful weather satellite, was launched, revolutionizing weather forecasting and Earth observation.

03-31.title: Eiffel Tower Opens
03-31.description: On March 31, 1889, the Eiffel Tower opened to the public, representing a major achievement in structural engineering and materials science for its time.
